Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders

Class EntityListViewFactoryBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders.AbstractWritableAttributesBuilder<EntityViewFactory>
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders.EntityViewFactoryBuilder
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders.EntityListViewFactoryBuilder
@Component @Scope("prototype") public class EntityListViewFactoryBuilder extends EntityViewFactoryBuilder
Extends the default EntityViewFactoryBuilder with properties for a list view of entities instead of a single entity view.
Since:
2.0.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme

    • transactionManager

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder transactionManager(String transactionManagerName)
      Description copied from class: EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Set the name of the PlatformTransactionManager bean that should be used by the DispatchingEntityViewFactory. If null, will remove any previously registered transaction manager.

      This setting will simply be ignored if:

      • the EntityViewFactory is not a DispatchingEntityViewFactory
      • there is no TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry
      • there is no PlatformTransactionManager with that name in the bean factory
      Overrides:
      transactionManager in class EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Parameters:
      transactionManagerName - bean name
      Returns:
      current builder
      See Also:
      • TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry

    • transactionManager

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder transactionManager(org.springframework.transaction.PlatformTransactionManager transactionManager)
      Description copied from class: EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Set the PlatformTransactionManager bean that should be used by the DispatchingEntityViewFactory. If null, will remove any previously registered transaction manager. If the EntityViewFactory is not a DispatchingEntityViewFactory or does not have a TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry, this setting will be ignored.
      Overrides:
      transactionManager in class EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Parameters:
      transactionManager - to use
      Returns:
      current builder
      See Also:
      • TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry

    • transactionTemplate

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder transactionTemplate(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate transactionTemplate)
      Description copied from class: EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Set the TransactionTemplate bean that should be used by the DispatchingEntityViewFactory. If null, will remove any previously registered transaction template. If the EntityViewFactory is not a DispatchingEntityViewFactory or does not have a TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry, this setting will be ignored.

      Use this method if you want to deviate from the default transaction settings, else it should be sufficient to simply specify the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

      Overrides:
      transactionTemplate in class EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Parameters:
      transactionTemplate - to use
      Returns:
      current builder
      See Also:
      • TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry
      • EntityViewFactoryBuilder.transactionManager(String)
      • EntityViewFactoryBuilder.transactionManager(PlatformTransactionManager)

    • factory

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder factory(EntityViewFactory factory)
      Description copied from class: EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Configure the specific EntityViewFactory that should be used for this view. This will take precedence over a registered EntityViewFactoryBuilder.factoryType(Class).

      NOTE that the factory will most likely be modified by this builder, so only use prototype instances.

      Overrides:
      factory in class EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Parameters:
      factory - to use
      Returns:
      current builder

    • postProcess

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder postProcess(BiConsumer<EntityViewFactory,EntityViewProcessorRegistry> postProcessor)
      Description copied from class: EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Add a post processor for this entire view factory. If the view factory is not of type DispatchingEntityViewFactory, the second parameter (EntityViewProcessorRegistry) will be null.

      Use this method if you want to make global modifications like changing the EntityViewProcessor ordering.

      The post processors will be called after general building.

      Overrides:
      postProcess in class EntityViewFactoryBuilder
      Parameters:
      postProcessor - post processor
      Returns:
      current builder

    • entityQueryFilter

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder entityQueryFilter(Consumer<EntityQueryFilterConfiguration.EntityQueryFilterConfigurationBuilder> consumer)
      Configure EntityQuery based filtering on this list view. This registers the EntityQueryFilterProcessor and allows you to customize the EntityQueryFilterConfiguration.
      Parameters:
      consumer - to modify the configuration
      Returns:
      current builder

    • entityQueryFilter

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder entityQueryFilter(boolean enabled)
      Enable default EntityQuery based filtering for this list. Amounts to the same as manually registering a EntityQueryFilterProcessor using viewProcessor(EntityViewProcessor).

      Calling with false will remove the processor if it was activated before.

      Parameters:
      enabled - true if filter should be added, false if not (or removed again)
      Returns:
      current builder

    • entityQueryPredicate

      public EntityListViewFactoryBuilder entityQueryPredicate(String predicate)
      Configure a fixed default predicate that should be used when fetching the items. This requires a valid EntityQueryParser to be available for that EntityConfiguration as the EntityQueryExecutor will be favoured over the default repository.

      The default predicate can not be removed and will always be applied. Even if entityQueryFilter(boolean) is enabled.

      Note: using entityQueryFilter(Consumer) allows for more advanced configuration options like appending base queries.

      Parameters:
      predicate - as EQL statement
      Returns:
      current builder

    • configureRenderingProcessors

      protected void configureRenderingProcessors(EntityViewProcessorRegistry processorRegistry, EntityPropertySelector propertiesToShow, ViewElementMode viewElementMode)
      Overrides:
      configureRenderingProcessors in class EntityViewFactoryBuilder
